name: At the Source
description: The Progenitors' technology has long been hidden away for a reason. But the anomaly crisis has also led to the secret getting out. Can the galaxy's most dangerous secret be kept under wraps?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Supply Missions in one phase, and Specialist Missions in another phase.
-- In a Specialist Event, you will select crew to engage in Specialist Missions.
-- Only a single crew with corresponding skills can be assigned to a Specialist Mission. After the mission is complete, that crew will be disabled from doing Specialist Missions for some period of time.
-- Specialist Missions take time to complete. The higher selected crew skills are the less time it will take them to complete a mission.
-- Only the highest skill of a crew is considered when calculating time to complete a mission.
-- Using crew with matching Specialist Mission bonus traits will significantly decrease time needed to complete a mission.
-- Each time a Specialist Mission is completed, some progress is also gained on the Main Mission. Completing the Main Mission rewards substantial amounts of Event Victory Points.
-- When you fail to gain bonus progress on the Main Mission using featured crew or crew with matching event bonus traits, the bonus progress chance goes up slightly the next time you use such crew in a mission. If you score the bonus progress, the bonus chance amount goes back to its initial value. 
-- Using any version of Progenitor, Vellek, Brooks, or Undercover Operatives will provide a bonus to Supply Missions and Specialist Missions.
-- Every Faction or Specialist Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 1 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Progenitor, Vellek, Brooks, or Undercover Operatives
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Torres
featured_crew.flavor: Torres' Klingon aggression sometimes comes in handy, such as when faced with a Malon who was sabotaging the ship and was not in the mood for negotiations.

action.name: Get The Hell Away From There, Now!

featured_crew.name: Brooks
featured_crew.flavor: Journalist and ex-lover of Mayweather. Suspected of spying for Terra Prime, but acquitted after the real spy was caught.

action.name: We Never Had A Problem Mixing Work And Pleasure

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Reed
rewards.flavor: Pushed into serving Section 31, Malcolm Reed investigated a secret Klingon program.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Torres' Klingon aggression sometimes comes in handy, such as when faced with a Malon who was sabotaging the ship and was not in the mood for negotiations.

adventures.name: A Voice From the Past
adventures.description: Decode an encrypted message said to be from the Progenitors.

adventures.name: The Chase is On
adventures.description: Track down the pieces of the Progenitors' puzzle.

adventures.name: Guardrails in Place
adventures.description: Meet leaders to decide how to handle the tech getting out.

adventures.name: Burying the Seeds
adventures.description: Unearth the truth of life itself by burying the leads.

rewards.name: At the Source
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

missions.title: Omnipotent Gardeners
missions.description: Find out what Q knows with %{pool_faction} crew.

missions.title: Breaking the Mirror
missions.description: Snoop on Mirror operatives with %{pool_faction} tech.

missions.title: A Price on Life
missions.description: Help %{pool_faction} crew tail Ferengi who may have info.

missions.title: Dangerous Data
missions.description: Block Yridians from stealing data with %{pool_faction} tech.

missions.title: The Weight of the Future
missions.description: Speak with %{pool_faction} leaders about what to do.

rewards.name: Brooks
rewards.flavor: Journalist and ex-lover of Mayweather. Suspected of spying for Terra Prime, but acquitted after the real spy was caught.

action.name: We Never Had A Problem Mixing Work And Pleasure

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Learn the secrets of life itself with the Augments.

potential_rewards.name: Augment Transmission
potential_rewards.flavor: Spent to acquire Augments faction missions.

potential_rewards.name: Credits
potential_rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

goals.flavor: Hunt those trying to unearth the tech with the Hirogen.

screens.text: "Thank you for accepting my encrypted communication, Captain. I'm counting on you to keep what I'm about to share between us. What would you do if you came into possession of technology that could allow you to create life itself?"

"I know, it sounds unbelievable, but I've found evidence that humanoids' common galactic ancestor may have also left such technology behind - and that there's a network of individuals sworn to keep this technology hidden."

"I'm sorry for interrupting, but maybe if you want to share such a galaxy-shattering secret, you should do a better job with your encryption. Though, unfortunately, if you know about the Progenitors' technology, it's likely the secret has spread wider than I first thought."

"'Progenitors'? What a fitting name for them. Unfortunately, my sources also confirm others are actively seeking the technology - and that those guarding it are in danger. Ironically, the only way we may be able to secure it is to unearth the secrets ourselves."

"Thank you for accepting my encrypted communication, Captain. I'm counting on you to keep what I'm about to share between us. What would you do if you came into possession of technology that could allow you to create life itself?"

"I know, it sounds unbelievable, but I've found evidence that humanoids' common galactic ancestor may have also left such technology behind - and that there's a network of individuals sworn to keep this technology hidden."

"I'm sorry for interrupting, but maybe if you want to share such a galaxy-shattering secret, you should do a better job with your encryption. Though, unfortunately, if you know about the Progenitors' technology, it's likely the secret has spread wider than I first thought."

"'Progenitors'? What a fitting name for them. Unfortunately, my sources also confirm others are actively seeking the technology - and that those guarding it are in danger. Ironically, the only way we may be able to secure it is to unearth the secrets ourselves."

"Well done, Captain. You managed to gain more information than I could have imagined. Thank you for your discretion. As you can imagine, each person who learns about this increases the risk of the secret being exposed."

responses.text: "How exactly do we get more information without making the leak worse?"
"Where exactly did you get this scoop from?"

screens.text: "And yet here you are, sharing this highly protected information with someone else. I hope my faith in the Federation was not misplaced and that your lax security protocols are not what allowed this secret to leak."
"So far, we've intercepted communications from Khan, two Hirogen vessels, a Yridian vessel, and even from the Borg Collective. That's concerning enough, but I doubt they're the only ones."

"That is precisely the challenge. I am still concerned your Federation is the source of the leak. If it is, then the responsibility is on all of you to get this situation under control. Too much is at stake."

"Captain, you know I can't reveal my sources. If this is too much and you don't feel comfortable continuing this investigation, I would understand. Though I think you're already in pretty deep as it is."
"Our best course of action at this point may be to track down who else is pursuing the Progenitors' technology. Maybe we'll figure out how it got out - and how best to secure it."

"Well done, Captain. You managed to gain more information than I could have imagined. Thank you for your discretion. As you can imagine, each person who learns about this increases the risk of the secret being exposed."

responses.text: "How exactly do we get more information without making the leak worse?"
"Where exactly did you get this scoop from?"

screens.text: "And yet here you are, sharing this highly protected information with someone else. I hope my faith in the Federation was not misplaced and that your lax security protocols are not what allowed this secret to leak."
"So far, we've intercepted communications from Khan, two Hirogen vessels, a Yridian vessel, and even from the Borg Collective. That's concerning enough, but I doubt they're the only ones."

"That is precisely the challenge. I am still concerned your Federation is the source of the leak. If it is, then the responsibility is on all of you to get this situation under control. Too much is at stake."

"Captain, you know I can't reveal my sources. If this is too much and you don't feel comfortable continuing this investigation, I would understand. Though I think you're already in pretty deep as it is."
"Our best course of action at this point may be to track down who else is pursuing the Progenitors' technology. Maybe we'll figure out how it got out - and how best to secure it."
